intro: Schoenus submicrostachyus, commonly known as the dwarf swamp grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and swampy areas. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are often difficult to see. Its botanical features include rhizomes that help it spread vegetatively, and it thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils. Schoenus submicrostachyus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
